intro: Porophyllum leucospermum, commonly known as white-rayed tarweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are gray-green and hairy, while its flowers consist of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray flowers. Porophyllum leucospermum is often found in open plains and along roadsides, contributing to local biodiversity.
